intro: Tithymalus falcatus subsp. macrostegius, commonly known as the broad-stemmed tithymalus, is a herbaceous perennial native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbel-like flower clusters. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with finely divided, fern-like leaves that are hairy on the underside. Its flowers are small, white to pale yellow, and bloom in late spring to early summer. This subspecies is valued in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
